text: Generally samples are embedded in LMA (SERVA - 2% ; made in H20, filtered with 200 um filters and kept in aliquots at 4 deg – not sure is really necessary to have LM agar..) before going to CUBIC-2; sample and agar block are basically cleared together; once they are in CUBIC2 and well clear, I switch to the oil-mix making (1 wash in the oil mix + leave in oil) ; then, for precaution I generally wait at least 1 our before the imaging (to let the sample equilibrate), but I get the feeling that OIL and CUBIC really do not mix; they have slightly different RIs, but probably also because the agar block has quite flat borders, I do not see many RI-mismatch aberration (just need to realign a bit the ligh-sheets); sorry for the delay, I`m stuck at the FOM meeting (that btw I super L-sheet interesting!); hope it helps!

elements.text: Generally samples are embedded in LMA (SERVA - 2% ; made in H20, filtered with 200 um filters and kept in aliquots at 4 deg – not sure is really necessary to have LM agar..) before going to CUBIC-2; sample and agar block are basically cleared together; once they are in CUBIC2 and well clear, I switch to the oil-mix making (1 wash in the oil mix + leave in oil) ; then, for precaution I generally wait at least 1 our before the imaging (to let the sample equilibrate), but I get the feeling that OIL and CUBIC really do not mix; they have slightly different RIs, but probably also because the agar block has quite flat borders, I do not see many RI-mismatch aberration (just need to realign a bit the ligh-sheets); sorry for the delay, I`m stuck at the FOM meeting (that btw I super L-sheet interesting!); hope it helps!

text: Glad to tell you that Light-sheet is happily scattering at the FOM meeting with an honour place at the 1st day plenary lecture (other mesmerizing J Huisken lecture) and 3 light-sheet dedicated sessions today!! Program and abstracts here <https://www.focusonmicroscopy.org/2023-program-online/?event_id=1791>  + updates on Twitter #FOM2023 <https://twitter.com/hashtag/FOM2023?src=hashtag_click>
